GlossEntry.GlossDef:
In the field of bibliography (so called library science), one calls analytic a description or record for a work that is contained in another bibliographic unit, i.e., an article that is published in a (volume of a) journal and not as an individual physical unit. In German, one speaks of publications that are (un)selbstständig, (in)dependant.
Analytic description is usually considered the province of database services, not of the library system, so the cataloguing rules and standards mostly ignore this topic.
